original_title: Sri Lanka President appoints NPP cabinet minsters
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Anura Dissanayake has appointed the following ministers to run the National People’s Power administration after sweeping the general elections.
Dissanayake retained the posts of Minister of Defence, and Minister of Finance, Planning and Digital Economy.
1. Finance, Economic Development and Defence – President Anura Kumara Dissanayake
2. Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Training – Harini Amarasuriya
3. Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism – Vijitha Herath
4. Minister of Public Administration and local government – Chandana Abeyratne
5. Minister of Justice and National Integration – Harshana Nanayakkara
7. Minister of Agriculture, Livestock and Land – Don Lalkantha
8. Minister of urban Development, Construction, Housing – Anura Karunathilaka
9. Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources – Ramalingam Chandrasekar
10. Minister of Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment – Upali Pannilage
11. Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development – Sunil Handunetti
12. Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs – Ananda Wijepala
13. Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation – Bimal Rathnayaka
14. Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs – Hiniduma Sunil Senevi
16. Minister of Plantations and Community Infrastructure – Samantha Vidyarathne
17. Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports – Sunil Kumara Gamage
18. Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development – Wasantha Samarasinghe
